title: Amavi 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Aromas of cocoa, herb, woodspice and blue and black fruit lead to lush, palate-coating dark fruit flavors that display depth and richness, backed by a dry lick of tannins.

title: Blackbird Vineyards 2013 Arise Red (Napa Valley)
description: This is a Merlot-dominant blend, with 30% Cabernet Sauvignon and 15% Cabernet Franc blended in. It offers cooler-climate elements of dried herb, cedar and currant, with the tannins sleek and polished. The finish flirts with a taste of coconut. Drink now through 2021.

title: Valle dell'Acate 2014 Il Frappato Frappato (Vittoria)
description: Fragrant and fresh, this luminous wine opens with aromas of red berry, blueberry, violet, white rose and a potpourri of spice while the savory palate doles out crushed raspberry, juicy morello cherry and white pepper. It's easy drinking, thanks to tangy acidity and light, silky tannins. Chill it down for a perfect summer red.

title: Château Dassault 2013  Saint-Émilion
description: Typical of early-maturing, Merlot-based wines from this vintage, this is rich, swirling with black-berry fruits and generous tannins. The fresh, almost crisp aftertaste is already attractive. Drink from 2019.

title: Château les Ormes de Pez 2013  Saint-Estèphe
description: Made by the team from Château Lynch-Bages, this estate crafts wines in the same generous style. A firm, tannic edge gives structure to the juicy acidity and black currant flavors. Drink from 2018.

title: Château Meyney 2010 La Chapelle de Meyney  (Saint-Estèphe)
description: The second wine of Château Meyney comes from one of the top estates of the appellation. From selected parcels and barrels of wine, this shows the same sense of structure as the top wine, while the fruitiness is developing more quickly. The black currant and plum-juice flavors are already bursting from the tannins. Drink from 2017.

title: Chateau Rollat 2011 Edouard Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Aromas convey cedar, savory herb, earth, black licorice and cherry. The dark flavors are reserved in style but still display richness, supported by fine-grained tannins.

title: Della 2013 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: A big, burly, hedonistic wine, this offers layers of pronounced baked apple, pear and caramel. The oak wraps itself around in cinnamon-toast waves, with sizable power on the palate. The joy ride ends with a balanced sense of wet stone, fresh and refined.

title: Dog Point 2013 Section 94 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: From a couple of pioneers of the style, this barrel-fermented Sauvignon Blanc shows aggressive fumé-style aromas of smoky struck flint. Grilled melon and fig flavors take hold of the silky midpalate, followed by lingering grapefruit on the finish. True to its usual impressive standard.

title: Seven Hills 2013 McClellan Estate Vineyard Petit Verdot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: It's rare to find a pure varietal example that all comes from a single site. This one offers aromas of flowers, moist soil, purple fruit and exotic spice followed by a dense, almost impenetrable palate that offers freshness and length. It's a standout example of the variety.

title: Shannon Ridge 2013 High Elevation Collection Petite Sirah (Lake County)
description: Drenched with dark and rich fruit flavors as well as velvety and thick tannins, this is a bold and mouth-coating wine that still carries off a bit of polish. A hint of sweetness helps the immense structure soften around the edges and lets dark chocolate and cassis liqueur flavors come through. Drink now through 2020.

title: Silverado 2012 GEO Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: This is an inaugural release of this variety from the Mount George Vineyard in cool Coombsville, granted AVA status in 2011. Juicy and soft in blackberry and stone fruit, the wine is cradled by generous tannins and herbal tones. Full bodied, its sinewy structure suggests it would benefit from more time in bottle; cellar through 2022.

title: Potek 2012 Tierra Alata Syrah (Ballard Canyon)
description: This wine is stunningly savory on the nose, with blackberry and blueberry fruit seasoned by melted chocolate mint, lush lilacs and a hint of caramel. The palate proves more tart than expected, but lively with licorice, dark coffee, boysenberry reduction and elderberry flavors.

title: Vavasour 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Awatere Valley)
description: Subtle green notes highlight concentrated fruit in this wine. Drilling down, it's something akin to celery leaf alongside nectarine and ripe citrus. It's plump in the mouth, with a long, balanced aftertaste. Well done, from start to finish.

title: Aigner 2014 Privat Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)
description: Fleshy, ripe notes of yellow pear lead to a yeasty palate that fizzes with citric lift. Lively and fresh, light-footed, concentrated and energetic, this is a sip of Austrian life. The extra dollop of fresh acidity brightens the entire wine and makes for very appetizing, spicy drinking with a zesty finish.

title: àMaurice 2013 Anne Martin McCool Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: A blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Merlot, this wine opens with reserved aromas of herbs and assorted barrel spices, with blackberry lurking in the background. The plimp black-fruit flavors have depth and immediate appeal.

title: Anaba 2013 Dutton Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine hails from two fine vineyard sources belonging to the Dutton family—Mill Station Vineyard and Shop Bloc—within the Green Valley AVA embedded within the boundaries of the Russian River. Dry and extracted, it exudes honeysuckle and jasmine around lush layers of lemon, ginger candy and melon.

title: Angelo Cellars 2010 Reverence Vineyard Private Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: Given plenty of time in bottle, this wine is drinking beautifully now, balanced and pillowy in texture. Vanilla-cherry and clove sit atop a note of graham cracker, lingering around smoky oak and a lengthy finish.

title: Château Tronquoy-Lalande 2013  Saint-Estèphe
description: This wine has ripe black fruits, fresh acidity and black-plum flavors. It is rich while still showing plenty of bright fruity acidity. With a light sense of structure, the wine is more about fresh fruits that are also jammy. Drink from 2020.

title: Concannon 2010 Reserve Petite Sirah (Livermore Valley)
description: From the winery that first popularized Petite Sirah in California, this vintage has vivid black-pepper aromas and a deep, inky color. Rich and concentrated flavors suggest pomegranate juice, blackberries and clove. Lavish and layered tannins give the texture an almost thick viscosity that coats the mouth for a lasting impression.

title: COS 2013  Cerasuolo di Vittoria Classico
description: Dark berry, baking spice, tilled soil and a hint of new leather aromas unfold on this polished, earthy red. The juicy palate tastes of black cherry, cinnamon, orange zest, and aromatic herb while its mineral vein is noticeable alongside smooth tannins and fresh acidity. Enjoy through 2023.

title: Cypress 2013 Syrah (Hawke's Bay)
description: Blueberries and spice—think baking spices and cracked pepper—mingle easily in this medium-bodied, velvety-textured Syrah. Vanilla oak makes an appearance as well, but overall the wine is savory, with ample spice and structure. Drink now–2020.

title: Davis Family 2013 Dutton Ranch Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Wild earth and forest floor surround elements of truffle, black tea and cardamom in this vineyard-designate, a savory and wholly compelling wine. Crisp orange blossom and orange peel buoy the minerality and sensation of crushed rocks and rose petals.

title: Château Batailley 2013  Pauillac
description: Consultant Denis Dubourdieu has made the most of the difficult vintage, bringing out the fruit and ripe black-currant flavors. This balanced wine will develop attractively and quickly. Drink from 2019.

title: Château Cheval Blanc 2013 Le Petit Cheval  (Saint-Émilion)
description: Almost entirely Merlot, this is a rich and fruity wine. Dusty tannins hang in suspension alongside the ripe blackberry fruits. The wine is juicy, fresh with acidity and likely to develop quickly. Drink from 2018.

title: Château Couhins-Lurton 2013  Pessac-Léognan
description: This is a ripe wine, with attractive red-berry flavors and acidity. It has a good sense of structure, solid with balanced tannins and ample acidity. The wine is developing well and should be ready to drink from 2020.

title: Château d'Armailhac 2013  Pauillac
description: With great freshness, this is an attractive, fruity wine with final ripe berry flavors that are delicately leavened and given weight by tannins. There is already a drinkable balance from the fruit, although the wine needs more time to be in harmony. Drink from 2018.

title: Château de Pez 2013  Saint-Estèphe
description: One of several châteaux in Saint-Estèphe that come from the plateau of Pez, this is a lightly structured wine, with already-forward black currant fruitiness and acidity. It's developing quickly and will be ready to drink from 2018.

title: Château la Gaffelière 2013 Clos la Gaffelière  (Saint-Émilion)
description: This is the second wine from Premier Grand Cru Classé estate La Gaffelière, made from a selection of vines and barrels. It is rich and very ripe with bold black-fruit flavors and a dark, firm structure. The wine is already in balance, showing that it will develop quickly and attractively. Drink from 2018.

title: Château Lafargue 2013  Pessac-Léognan
description: This wine has all the right elements with structure, tannins and ripe berry fruits. It's full of blackberry and plum flavors that are underlined with a firm structure and layers of toast. Drink from 2019. Third-generation owner Jean-Pierre Leymarie was born on the estate. It has grown from five acres in 1983 to 45 acres.
